body_html:
Status on this? It's a huge limitation of the tf.estimator API that labels can only be a tensor, IMO. It would be a lot nicer to have named tensors in the case of multi-headed output.

EDIT: I see that @facaiy's pr was merged to master, so the docs should be updated accordingly (e.g. https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/input_fn#passing_input_fn_data_to_your_model)
body_text:
Status on this? It's a huge limitation of the tf.estimator API that labels can only be a tensor, IMO. It would be a lot nicer to have named tensors in the case of multi-headed output.
EDIT: I see that @facaiy's pr was merged to master, so the docs should be updated accordingly (e.g. https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/input_fn#passing_input_fn_data_to_your_model)
body:
Status on this? It's a huge limitation of the tf.estimator API that labels can only be a tensor, IMO. It would be a lot nicer to have named tensors in the case of multi-headed output.

EDIT: I see that @facaiy's pr was merged to master, so the docs should be updated accordingly (e.g. https://www.tensorflow.org/get_started/input_fn#passing_input_fn_data_to_your_model)
